name: Fab Four Quiz | Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which singing group has four singers?
questions.explanation:
a quartet.

	Barbershop quartets are groups of four--usually male--singers. Each man in the group has a different kind of singing voice. For instance, the bass singer has a VERY deep voice.

questions.text: Which U.S. coin is equal to one-fourth of a dollar?
questions.explanation:
a quarter.

	The word "quarter" has the same root as "quatre", the French word for "four".

questions.text: When you multiply a number by four, you _______.
A quad is a kind of courtyard. How is it shaped?
questions.explanation:
It is square or rectangular.

	Quads can be found at schools and colleges and have four sides. Most quads are bordered by buildings.

questions.text: What is a quadriplegic? (Choose the BEST answer.)
questions.correct: A person who cannot move his or her arms and legs.
options: A person who cannot move his or her legs.
A person whose arms are permanently injured.
A person with a brain injury.
questions.explanation:
A person who cannot move his or her arms and legs.

	The root "quad" in "quadriplegic" refers to four limbs: two arms and two legs.

questions.text: Which of these Spanish words means "four"?
questions.explanation:
cuatro.

	UNO means "one". CINCO means "five". And OCHO means "eight".

questions.text: If a mother gives birth to four babies at once, what are they called?
questions.explanation:
quadruplets.

	Quadruplets are very rare. Quintuplets (five babies at once) are VERY VERY rare. Triplets (three babies) are pretty rare and twins are fairly common. You probably know at least one set of twins. I have twin cousins. My nephew has three friends (two sisters and a brother) who are triplets.

questions.text: Which is true of a movie with quadraphonic sound?
questions.correct: Its sounds come from four speakers.
options: Its sounds come from three speakers.
Its sounds are too loud for most viewers.
It is shown on a huge square screen.
questions.explanation:
Its sounds come from four speakers.

	The Greek root word "phon" means "sound."

questions.text: How many years equal a quarter of a century?
questions.explanation:
25.

	Dividing something into quarters means to divide it into four equal parts. Since a century is 100 years, a quarter of a century is 25 years.

questions.text: How many quarts of milk are in one gallon?
questions.explanation:
four.

	The word "quart" has the same Latin root as in "quarter" and "quatre" (the French word for "four"). A quart is a liquid measurement that is equal to two pints. A pint is equal to two cups. So a quart is equal to four cups.
